intro: Claytonia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. Its leaves are typically succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native arid environment. Claytonia peruviana thrives in cool, moist conditions and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
